chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
x: bool

Goal:
bin_add ⟘ ⟘ x = (⟘, x)

Premises:
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
Notation bin_add := bool_add_with_rem
partition_cons2 : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (a : A) (l l1 l2 : list A), partition f l = (l1, l2) -> f a = ⟘ -> partition f (a :: l) = (l1, a :: l2)
bool_add_with_rem = fun a b c : bool => if a then if b then if c then (⟙, ⟙) else (⟙, ⟘) else if c then (⟙, ⟘) else (⟘, ⟙) else if b then if c then (⟙, ⟘) else (⟘, ⟙) else if c then (⟘, ⟙) else (⟘, ⟘) : bool -> bool -> bool -> bool * bool Arguments bool_add_with_rem (_ _ _)%bool_scope
Lexicographic_Product.swap_Acc : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (x y : A), Acc (Relation_Operators.swapprod A R) (x, y) -> Acc (Relation_Operators.swapprod A R) (y, x)
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
Relation_Operators.sp_swap : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x, y) p -> Relation_Operators.swapprod A R (y, x) p
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => y | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive symprod (A B : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (leB : B -> B -> Prop) : A * B -> A * B -> Prop := left_sym : forall x x' : A, leA x x' -> forall y : B, Relation_Operators.symprod A B leA leB (x, y) (x', y) | right_sym : forall y y' : B, leB y y' -> forall x : A, Relation_Operators.symprod A B leA leB (x, y) (x, y') Arguments Relation_Operators.symprod (_ _)%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.left_sym (_ _)%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.right_sym (_ _)%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
Lexicographic_Product.Acc_swapprod : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (x y : A), Acc R x -> Acc R y -> Acc (Relation_Operators.swapprod A R) (x, y)
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive swapprod (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) : A * A -> A * A -> Prop := sp_noswap : forall (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x, y) p -> Relation_Operators.swapprod A R (x, y) p | sp_swap : forall (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x, y) p -> Relation_Operators.swapprod A R (y, x) p Arguments Relation_Operators.swapprod _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.sp_noswap _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.sp_swap _%type_scope _%function_scope
Relation_Operators.left_sym : forall (A B : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (leB : B -> B -> Prop) (x x' : A), leA x x' -> forall y : B, Relation_Operators.symprod A B leA leB (x, y) (x', y)
Relation_Operators.right_sym : forall (A B : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (leB : B -> B -> Prop) (y y' : B), leB y y' -> forall x : A, Relation_Operators.symprod A B leA leB (x, y) (x, y')
Lexicographic_Product.Acc_symprod : forall (A B : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (leB : B -> B -> Prop) (x : A), Acc leA x -> forall y : B, Acc leB y -> Acc (Relation_Operators.symprod A B leA leB) (x, y)
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_iff : forall n m : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat n = BinInt.Z.of_nat m < -> n = m
partition_cons1 : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (a : A) (l l1 l2 : list A), partition f l = (l1, l2) -> f a = ⟙ -> partition f (a :: l) = (a :: l1, l2)
partition_inv_nil : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A), partition f l = (nil, nil) < -> l = nil
combine_split : forall (A B : Type) (l : list A) (l' : list B), length l = length l' -> split (combine l l') = (l, l')
ZifyClasses.mkapp : forall (S1 S2 T : Type) (OP : S1 -> S2) (I1 : S1 -> T) (I2 : S2 -> T) (TUOP : T -> T), (forall n : S1, I2 (OP n) = TUOP (I1 n)) -> forall (s1 : S1) (t1 : T), I1 s1 = t1 -> I2 (OP s1) = TUOP t1
ZifyClasses.mkapp2 : forall (S1 S2 S3 T : Type) (Op : S1 -> S2 -> S3) (I1 : S1 -> T) (I2 : S2 -> T) (I3 : S3 -> T) (TBOP : T -> T -> T), (forall (n : S1) (m : S2), I3 (Op n m) = TBOP (I1 n) (I2 m)) -> forall (s1 : S1) (t1 : T), I1 s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S2) (t2 : T), I2 s2 = t2 -> I3 (Op s1 s2) = TBOP t1 t2
div2_2p0 : forall p : nat, div2 (2 * p) = (p, ⟘)
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_succ : forall n : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat (S n) = BinInt.Z.succ (BinInt.Z.of_nat n)
div2_2p1 : forall p : nat, div2 (2 * p + 1) = (p, ⟙)
Tauto.BFormula = fun A : Type => Tauto.GFormula : Type -> Type Arguments Tauto.BFormula _%type_scope
combine_nth : forall (A B : Type) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (n : nat) (x : A) (y : B), length l = length l' -> nth n (combine l l') (x, y) = (nth n l x, nth n l' y)
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_mul : forall n m : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat (n * m) = BinInt.Z.mul (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_add : forall n m : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat (n + m) = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker_sound : forall (f : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula BinNums.Z)) (w : list ZMicromega.ZArithProof), ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker f w = ⟙ -> forall env : RingMicromega.PolEnv BinNums.Z, Tauto.eval_bf (ZMicromega.Zeval_formula env) f
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
ZifyClasses.mkrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : S -> T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (I n) (I m)) -> forall (s1 : S) (t1 : T), I s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S) (t2 : T), I s2 = t2 -> R s1 s2 < -> TR t1 t2
VectorSpec.uncons_cons : forall (a : ?A) (v : VectorDef.t ?A ?n), VectorDef.uncons (VectorDef.cons ?A a ?n v) = (a, v) where ?A : [x : bool |- Type] ?n : [x : bool |- nat]
Ascii.byte_of_ascii = fun a : Ascii.ascii => let (b0, b1, b2, b3, b4, b5, b6, b7) := a in Byte.of_bits (b0, (b1, (b2, (b3, (b4, (b5, (b6, b7))))))) : Ascii.ascii -> Byte.byte Arguments Ascii.byte_of_ascii _%char_scope
split_nth : forall (A B : Type) (l : list (A * B)) (n : nat) (d : A * B), nth n l d = (nth n (fst (split l)) (fst d), nth n (snd (split l)) (snd d))
VectorDef.uncons = fun (A : Type) (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t A (S n)) => (VectorDef.hd v, VectorDef.tl v) : forall (A : Type) (n : nat), VectorDef.t A (S n) -> A * VectorDef.t A n Arguments VectorDef.uncons {A}%type_scope {n}%nat_scope
VectorSpec.splitat_append : forall (v : VectorDef.t ?A ?n) (w : VectorDef.t ?A ?m), VectorDef.splitat ?n (VectorDef.append v w) = (v, w) where ?A : [x : bool |- Type] ?n : [x : bool |- nat] ?m : [x : bool |- nat]
ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker = fun (f : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula BinNums.Z)) (w : list ZMicromega.ZArithProof) => Tauto.tauto_checker ZMicromega.Zunsat ZMicromega.Zdeduce ZMicromega.normalise ZMicromega.negate (fun cl : list (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z * unit) => ZMicromega.ZChecker (map fst cl)) f w : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula BinNums.Z) -> list ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> bool Arguments ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker _ _%list_scope
div2 = fix div2 (n : nat) : nat * bool := match n with | 0 => (0, ⟘) | 1 => (0, ⟙) | S (S n1) => let (p, b) := div2 n1 in (S p, b) end : nat -> nat * bool Arguments div2 _%nat_scope
VectorDef.append = fix append (A : Type) (n p : nat) (v : VectorDef.t A n) (w : VectorDef.t A p) {struct v} : VectorDef.t A (n + p) := match v in (VectorDef.t _ n0) return (VectorDef.t A (n0 + p)) with | VectorDef.nil _ => w | VectorDef.cons _ a n0 v' => VectorDef.cons A a (n0 + p) (append A n0 p v' w) end : forall (A : Type) (n p : nat), VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A p -> VectorDef.t A (n + p) Arguments VectorDef.append {A}%type_scope {n p}%nat_scope
Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : VectorDef.t A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A (S n) Arguments VectorDef.t _%type_scope _%nat_scope Arguments VectorDef.nil _%type_scope Arguments VectorDef.cons _%type_scope _ _%nat_scope
Inductive Op2 : Set := OpEq : RingMicromega.Op2 | OpNEq : RingMicromega.Op2 | OpLe : RingMicromega.Op2 | OpGe : RingMicromega.Op2 | OpLt : RingMicromega.Op2 | OpGt : RingMicromega.Op2
Relation_Operators.sp_noswap : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x, y) p -> Relation_Operators.swapprod A R (x, y) p
